name: julia
info:
# Julia set
Julia set is the boundary of region of points $z_0$ on complex plane, such that the sequence
$$
z_n = P(z_{n-1}), \quad n=1,2,\ldots
$$
is limited, where P(z) is a polynomial.

This example performs calculation of inner region of the Julia set for $P(z)=c-z^2$. The parameter, complex number $c$, can be changed interactively.

The simulation scheme contains an ?[FDE iterator](/doc#box/FdeIterator) that performs up to 300 iterations for the initial point $z_0$ to determine if the sequence $z_n$ is limited or not. There are also two checks that detect divergence (boxes ```norm```, ```tdiv```) and convergence (boxes ```diff```, ```dnorm```, ```tconv```) of the iterations, so in most cases much less iterations are necessary.

See also the =[Mandelbrot set](http://localhost:3000/editor?sim=mandelbrot) example.
